This facility has had no accidental releases in the last five years which meets the criteria set forth in 40 CFR 68.10.

Emergency Procedures Information

The Pioneer Silica Gel Plant Gas Plant maintains a written emergency procedure, which is in place to protect worker and public safety as well as the environment.  The procedures are for the possibility of a fire or explosion if a flammable substance is accidentally released.  The procedures address notification of local emergency response agencies if a release occurs.  Employees receive training in emergency procedures.  The emergency procedure is updated when necessary based on modifications made to the terminal facilities.   

The overall emergency procedure program for the Pioneer Silica Gel Plant is coordinated with the Lincoln County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC). This coordination includes periodic meetings of the committee, which includes local emergency response officials, local government officials and industry representatives.  The Pioneer Silica Gel Plant has around-the-clock communications capability with appropriate LEPC officials and emergency response organizations (e.g., fire department).  This provides a means of notifying the public of an incident, if necessary, as well as facilitating quick response to an incident.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The Pioneer Silica Gel Plant Gas Plant resolves all findings from PHAs, some of which result in modifications to the process.  Other recommendations for possible changes to improve safety come from periodic accident prevention program audits, incident investigations, or employee suggestions and recommendations.  The following changes are planned for implementation at the Pioneer Silica Gel Plant Gas Plant.

* No changes are planned.

y enforced at all Enterprise facilities, including the Pioneer Silica Gel Plant Gas Plant facility.  As part of the Enterprise safety program, the facility utilizes procedures that are included in the Enterprise program, but may not specifically be required at non-PSM and/or RMP Program 1 facilities (e.g. Safe work practice training; safe work permitting and hot work permitting).

Universal Prevention Activities

The accident prevention program summarized previously is applied to all RMP covered processes at Pioneer Silica Gel Plant Gas Plant.  Collectively, these prevention program activities help prevent potential accident scenarios that could be caused by equipment failures and human errors.

Specialized Safety Features

The Pioneer Silica Gel Plant Gas Plant has safety features on many units to help contain/control a release, to quickly detect a release and reduce the consequence of a release.  The following types of safety features are used in the covered processes:

Release Detection

* Hydrocarbon (hazardous gas) detectors and alarms
* Process building fire detectors and alarms
* Plant video surveillance system

Release Containment and Control

* Process relief valves that discharge to a flare to capture and incinerate episodic releases
* Valves to permit isolation of the process (manual or automated).
* Automatic shutdown systems for specific process parameters (e.g., high pressure).
* Secondary containment (curbs and dikes) to contain any release of liquid chemicals
* Redundant equipment and instrumentation where advisable
* Atmospheric relief devices

Release Mitigation

* Hand-held fire extinguishers
* Personnel trained in emergency response and procedures.
* Personnel protective equipment (e.g., chemical protective clothing, self-contained breathing apparatus, etc.)

Five Year Accident History

Records are kept for all significant accidental chemical releases that occur at our facility.  The following is a brief summary of accidental chemical releases in

t of the residue gas. Produced natural gas is delivered to the facility from a gas gathering system and inlet gas pipeline. Finished products are residual natural gas and extracted hydrocarbon liquids.  Residual gas is removed by pipeline systems and finished products are removed by truck.

The Natural Gas Processing process is regulated by Federal OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 and 40 CFR Part 68.  We have entered the facility as an RMP Program Level 1 facility.

Toxics

There are no toxic materials contained on site above the threshold limits.

Flammables

The Pioneer Silica Gel Plant Gas Plant was evaluated to determine if any regulated flammable substances exceeded the threshold quantity.  Enterprise identified the regulated substances and quantities to be kept on site based on the process design of the proposed process vessels. Listed flammable substances which are present above the threshold quantities at the Pioneer Silica Gel Plant are natural gas (methane), ethane, propane, iso-butane, normal butane, iso-pentane and pentane.

Offsite Consequence Analysis Results

The offsite consequence analysis will not be reflected in the executive summary but rather is reflected in the data components.  There are flammable substances on site and no toxic substances above the threshold quantity.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program

The following is a summary of the accidental release prevention program in place at Pioneer Silica Gel Plant.  The process at the facility is regulated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Risk Management Program (RMP) regulation (Program 1).  Release prevention is provided through the use of written operating procedures, employee training in written procedures, including normal operation and emergency release procedures, and in the design of safety and release prevention equipment installed at the terminal site. Pioneer Silica Gel Plant
Enterprise Products Operating LLC
Executive Summary
Risk Management Plan
EPA Identifier:  1000 0018 4613

Accidental Release Prevention and Response

At Enterprise, we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes (especially those using hazardous substances) in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public as well as protection of the environment.  This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented, including:

* A description of our facility and use of substances regulated by EPA's RMP regulation
* An overview of our accidental release prevention programs
* A five-year accident history for accidental releases of chemicals regulated by EPA's RMP rule
* An overview of our emergency response program
* An overview of planned improvements at the facility to help prevent accidental chemical releases from occurring and adversely affecting our employees, the public, and the environment

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances

The Pioneer Silica Gel Plant located in Lincoln County, Wyoming is owned by Enterprise Gas Processing LLC and is operated by Enterprise.

The Pioneer Silica Gel Plant is a combined processing complex comprised of two separate gas processing plants, designated as Plant 1 and Plant 2. The two plants are designed to utilize a solid bed adsorption or quick cycle process to recover primarily pentane and heavier natural gas liquids from the inlet gas. Smaller amounts of methane, ethane, propane and butanes are also recovered in the process, but the plant includes liquid stabilization equipment to remove the lighter components from the produced liquids and re-inject them in the outlet gas stream  The primary purpose of the facility is to control the hydrocarbon dew poin
